result.execSummary:
The defendant David P Coari was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David P Coari is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David P Coari was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • David P Coari was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Count 6, but Concurrent to 16CF204.

miscConds.notes: Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.

Court has reviewed letter from DOC and sentencing minutes of 7/14/16 should of read as follows per review of transcript from that hearnig - JOC shall be amended accordingly.
Count 5 -   Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions Consecutive to Count 6, but Concurrent to 16CF204.  
Count 6 -  DE is sentenced to 4 months in the KCJ commencing on 7/30/16 at 8:00 AM with credit for 3 days.  Huber & Work Crew authorized.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge.  Court costs & surcharge in both counts are to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
received from Janelle Nehring @ DOC
Huber allowed.
Bond applied; partial refund;   jk/mg   ck#16CH076654
Count 6
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Defendant, David P Coari, appeared with Attorney frank j Parise.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:   CT #5-   Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 1 year w/conditions.    Ct #6- 4 months in KCJ with Huber to report on 07-30-16 at 8am.  3 days credit for time served.  Sentence is concurrent to any other probation and consecutive to jail time.  Court costs ordered civil judgement if not paid.   No restitution requested.    Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.    Appeal rights given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, David P Coari, appeared with Attorney frank j Parise.  Clerk: PT
Amended Information filed by the State and case is resolved.  Counts 5 & 6 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 1, 2, 3, and 4 are Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered with 16CF204.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.
& Continued Posted

Atty Parise is requesting conditions of bond be modified and ADA Binger has no objection.  Upon hearing statements the no contact order is lifted and DE signs amended bond in court.  Parties request case be set over for a plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 09:20 am.
